addrLanguage.description: Select the default language for NetSuite users in this subsidiary. Individual users can choose their language at <_TABNAME=TRAN_USERPREFS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=TRAN_USERPREFS_> > Set Preferences.
addrLanguage.name: addrLanguage

checkLayout.externalId.description: Select the check layout you want to use when printing checks from this subsidiary.
checkLayout.externalId.displayName: Check Default Chart Type - External id
checkLayout.externalId.name: checkLayout.externalId

checkLayout.internalId.description: Select the check layout you want to use when printing checks from this subsidiary.
checkLayout.internalId.displayName: Check Default Chart Type - Internal id
checkLayout.internalId.name: checkLayout.internalId

checkLayout.name.description: Select the check layout you want to use when printing checks from this subsidiary.
checkLayout.name.name: checkLayout.name

currency.externalId.description: Set the base currency used by this subsidiary. If you do not set a currency, the currency of the parent is used.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: Set the base currency used by this subsidiary. If you do not set a currency, the currency of the parent is used.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: Set the base currency used by this subsidiary. If you do not set a currency, the currency of the parent is used.
currency.name.name: currency.name

edition.description: This field shows the edition of NetSuite used by this subsidiary.
edition.name: edition

email.description: Enter the return email address for this subsidiary.
email.name: email

fax.description: Enter the fax number for this subsidiary.
fax.name: fax

federalIdNumber.description: Enter the appropriate tax identification number for this subsidiary:    * United States  Employee Identification Number (EIN) or Federal Identification Number (FIN)    * Australia  Australian Business Number    * United Kingdom  VAT Registration Number    * All other locations  VAT Registration NumberThis number is required for all businesses with employees or acting as corporations or partnerships for tax purposes. If you think you need a tax identification number or do not know what your number is, contact the tax agency with jurisdiction over this subsidiary.
federalIdNumber.name: federalIdNumber

fiscalCalendar.externalId.description: Select the calendar to roll up accounting periods. The fiscal calendar determines the start date for the accounting year.
fiscalCalendar.externalId.name: fiscalCalendar.externalId

fiscalCalendar.internalId.description: Select the calendar to roll up accounting periods. The fiscal calendar determines the start date for the accounting year.
fiscalCalendar.internalId.name: fiscalCalendar.internalId

fiscalCalendar.name.description: Select the calendar to roll up accounting periods. The fiscal calendar determines the start date for the accounting year.
fiscalCalendar.name.name: fiscalCalendar.name

inboundEmail.description: Use this email address to forward email from your support email address for this subsidiary to NetSuite.When email arrives at this address, it is converted into case records in NetSuite. These cases records are associated with this subsidiary.You must set up this process with your email server. Click Help in the upper right corner of this page for more information.Caution: Only use this email address for the purpose of capturing email messages as case records. All messages sent to this address are converted to cases in your NetSuite account.
inboundEmail.name: inboundEmail

interCoAccount.externalId.description: If the Intercompany Time and Expense feature is enabled in your account, an Intercompany Account is automatically associated with a subsidiary after qualifying transactions are created in the system, such as a journal to eliminate Time and Expense.This account is determined by the subsidiary’s base currency. It is used to offset the transfer of charges from intercompany time and expenses from this subsidiary to others.
interCoAccount.externalId.name: interCoAccount.externalId

interCoAccount.internalId.description: If the Intercompany Time and Expense feature is enabled in your account, an Intercompany Account is automatically associated with a subsidiary after qualifying transactions are created in the system, such as a journal to eliminate Time and Expense.This account is determined by the subsidiary’s base currency. It is used to offset the transfer of charges from intercompany time and expenses from this subsidiary to others.
interCoAccount.internalId.name: interCoAccount.internalId

interCoAccount.name.description: If the Intercompany Time and Expense feature is enabled in your account, an Intercompany Account is automatically associated with a subsidiary after qualifying transactions are created in the system, such as a journal to eliminate Time and Expense.This account is determined by the subsidiary’s base currency. It is used to offset the transfer of charges from intercompany time and expenses from this subsidiary to others.
interCoAccount.name.name: interCoAccount.name

isElimination.description: Set to true if this subsidiary record is to be used only for journal entries and transactions between subsidiaries.
isElimination.name: isElimination

isInactive.description: Set to true if this subsidiary is no longer active or used in your account. Inactivated subsidiaries no longer show in the Subsidiary field on records and transactions unless they are currently attached to a record. Web sites of inactive subsidiaries are no longer available online.
isInactive.name: isInactive

legalName.description: Enter the legal name of this subsidiary as it shoudl appear on tax forms.
legalName.name: legalName

logo.externalId.description: Set the logo that should appear on printed and emailed transaction forms for this subsidiary. If you do not set a logo here, the logo for the parent subsidiary or company is used. To upload a logo into NetSuite, click Add New next to the Logo field in the UI. Be sure to check the Available Without Login box.
logo.externalId.name: logo.externalId

logo.internalId.description: Set the logo that should appear on printed and emailed transaction forms for this subsidiary. If you do not set a logo here, the logo for the parent subsidiary or company is used. To upload a logo into NetSuite, click Add New next to the Logo field in the UI. Be sure to check the Available Without Login box.
logo.internalId.name: logo.internalId

logo.name.description: Set the logo that should appear on printed and emailed transaction forms for this subsidiary. If you do not set a logo here, the logo for the parent subsidiary or company is used. To upload a logo into NetSuite, click Add New next to the Logo field in the UI. Be sure to check the Available Without Login box.
logo.name.name: logo.name

name.description: Set the name of this subsidiary the way it should appear on all forms except checks. Note: On checks, your company name is pre-printed with address and MICR information.
name.name: name

pageLogo.externalId.description: Select the logo image to be displayed on all pages for this subsidiary.Click New to upload a logo. Logos must be in JPG or GIF format.Note: The logo selected in this field does not affect printed forms. The logo on printed forms is determined by the selection in the Subsidiary Logo (Forms) field.To upload a logo, click Add New. Check the Available Without Login box.
pageLogo.externalId.name: pageLogo.externalId

pageLogo.internalId.description: Select the logo image to be displayed on all pages for this subsidiary.Click New to upload a logo. Logos must be in JPG or GIF format.Note: The logo selected in this field does not affect printed forms. The logo on printed forms is determined by the selection in the Subsidiary Logo (Forms) field.To upload a logo, click Add New. Check the Available Without Login box.
pageLogo.internalId.name: pageLogo.internalId

pageLogo.name.description: Select the logo image to be displayed on all pages for this subsidiary.Click New to upload a logo. Logos must be in JPG or GIF format.Note: The logo selected in this field does not affect printed forms. The logo on printed forms is determined by the selection in the Subsidiary Logo (Forms) field.To upload a logo, click Add New. Check the Available Without Login box.
pageLogo.name.name: pageLogo.name

parent.externalId.description: Set this field to the direct parent of the subsidiary.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.Setting a parent subsidiary sets your company hierarchy which is shown in the subsidiaries list.
parent.externalId.name: parent.externalId

parent.internalId.description: Set this field to the direct parent of the subsidiary.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.Setting a parent subsidiary sets your company hierarchy which is shown in the subsidiaries list.
parent.internalId.name: parent.internalId

parent.name.description: Set this field to the direct parent of the subsidiary.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.Setting a parent subsidiary sets your company hierarchy which is shown in the subsidiaries list.
parent.name.name: parent.name

purchaseOrderAmount.description: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and purchase order.
purchaseOrderAmount.displayName: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Amount Tolerance
purchaseOrderAmount.name: purchaseOrderAmount

purchaseOrderQuantity.description: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.
purchaseOrderQuantity.displayName: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Tolerance
purchaseOrderQuantity.name: purchaseOrderQuantity

purchaseOrderQuantityDiff.description: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.
purchaseOrderQuantityDiff.displayName: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Difference
purchaseOrderQuantityDiff.name: purchaseOrderQuantityDiff

receiptAmount.description: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and item receipt.
receiptAmount.displayName: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Amount Tolerance
receiptAmount.name: receiptAmount

receiptQuantity.description: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.
receiptQuantity.displayName: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Tolerance
receiptQuantity.name: receiptQuantity

receiptQuantityDiff.description: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.
receiptQuantityDiff.displayName: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Difference
receiptQuantityDiff.name: receiptQuantityDiff

showSubsidiaryName.description: Check this box to display only the subsidiary name with your role in the upper right  corner of a page.  In addition, when logging in to an employee center, vendor center, or customer center, the dashboard displays only the logo of the subsidiary, not the company logo.Clear this box to display the parent and the subsidiary name in your account.
showSubsidiaryName.name: showSubsidiaryName

ssnOrTin.description: If you are a US citizen and are self-employed with no employees, enter your Social Security Number (SSN). If you are not a US citizen but have a Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) issued by the IRS for purposes of operating a business with no employees, enter your TIN.These numbers are used for tax purposes only.
ssnOrTin.displayName: SSN or TIN (Social Security Number, Tax ID Number)
ssnOrTin.name: ssnOrTin

state.description: Select the state or province in which this subsidiary is located.
state.name: state

state1TaxNumber.description: Enter your Australian Company Number if one has been assigned to your company.For information about the ACN, see http://www.asic.gov.au.
state1TaxNumber.name: state1TaxNumber

taxFiscalCalendar.externalId.description: Select the calendar to roll up the tax periods. The tax fiscal calendar determines the start date for the tax year.
taxFiscalCalendar.externalId.name: taxFiscalCalendar.externalId

taxFiscalCalendar.internalId.description: Select the calendar to roll up the tax periods. The tax fiscal calendar determines the start date for the tax year.
taxFiscalCalendar.internalId.name: taxFiscalCalendar.internalId

taxFiscalCalendar.name.description: Select the calendar to roll up the tax periods. The tax fiscal calendar determines the start date for the tax year.
taxFiscalCalendar.name.name: taxFiscalCalendar.name

tranPrefix.description: When you use auto-generated numbering with NetSuite OneWorld, you can make your document number sequences independent per subsidiary.Enter up to 8 alphanumeric characters in this field to number transactions with a prefix to signify this subsidiary.To set up auto-generated numbering, go to Setup >  Setup Tasks > Auto-Generated Numbers. On the Document Numbers subtab, check the Use Subsidiary box next to each transaction to which this prefix should be applied.
tranPrefix.name: tranPrefix

type.value.description: Select the logo image to be displayed on all pages for this subsidiary.Click New to upload a logo. Logos must be in JPG or GIF format.Note: The logo selected in this field does not affect printed forms. The logo on printed forms is determined by the selection in the Subsidiary Logo (Forms) field.To upload a logo, click Add New. Check the Available Without Login box.
type.value.name: type.value

url.description: Set this subsidiary�s Web site address or URL.
url.name: url
